List.Title: Enhanced Power Automate Trigger Configuration
List.Description: Configure flow triggers for the Enhanced Power Automate Trigger Command Set.

Field.Name: Title
Field.Description: The title of the button displayed to the user for this trigger. Ex: Start an approval.

Field.Name: TriggerURL
Field.Description: The HTTP URL with which the flow can be triggered with. Ex: https://prod-178.westeurope.logic.azure.com:443/workflows/.../triggers/manual/paths/invoke...

Field.Name: HTTPType
Field.Description: The HTTP method to use for this trigger. Ex: POST.

Field.Name: OriginSecret
Field.Description: A secret which is passed to the flow and can be used to validate the origin of the request. Ex: 0f30da5d2e4c4565bd227cedd969cddb. Leave empty to not provide an origin secret.

Field.Name: ListWhitelist
Field.Description: The GUIDs of the lists to whitelist for this trigger. Ex: 7bc18c02-015f-49bd-a120-bb7a1dfc568f. Leave empty to whitelist all.

Field.Name: FolderWhitelist
Field.Description: The list relative folder path to whitelist for this trigger. Ex: Deliverables/Finals. Leave empty to whitelist all.

Field.Name: ContentTypeBlacklist
Field.Description: The (start of a) content type ID to blacklist for this trigger. Ex: 0x0120 (blacklist all folders). See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/office/developer/sharepoint-2010/ms452896(v=office.14) for all content type IDs. Leave empty to blacklist none.

Field.Name: FileExtensionBlacklist
Field.Description: The file extensions to blacklist for this trigger. Ex: docx. Leave empty to blacklist none.

Field.Name: SelectionLimit
Field.Description: The selected items limit for this trigger. Ex: 30.

Field.Name: RequestedUserInput
Field.Description: An array with objects of input fields to request and pass to the flow. An example value can be found here: https://github.com/cupo365/enhanced-power-automate-command-set/blob/main/resources/request-user-input-example.jsonc. Leave empty to not request any user input.
